step.context: \text{If }A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 1 & 2 & -3 \\ 5 & 0 & 2 \\ 1 & -1 & 1 \end{array} \right], B = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 3 & -1 & 2 \\ 4 & 2 & 5 \\ 2 & 0 & 3 \end{array} \right] \\ \qquad \text{ and } C = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 4 & 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 3 & 2 \\ 1 & -2 & 3 \end{array} \right] \\ \text{then, are all the following statements true?}\\

step.reason: \text{Only matrices having the {\bf same order} i.e.}\\ \text{equal no. of rows (m) and equal no. of}\\ \text{columns (n) can be added or subtracted and}\\ \text{the order of the resultant matrix is also m \times n.}

Given, }\\ A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 1 & 2 & -3 \\ 5 & 0 & 2 \\ 1 & -1 & 1 \end{array} \right], B = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 3 & -1 & 2 \\ 4 & 2 & 5 \\ 2 & 0 & 3 \end{array} \right] \\ \qquad \text{ and } C = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 4 & 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 3 & 2 \\ 1 & -2 & 3 \end{array} \right], \\
step.reason: A_{m \times n} + B_{m \times n} = S_{m \times n} = [s_{ij}]_{m \times n}\\ \text{where } s_{ij} = a_{ij} + b_{ij} \, (\forall \text{ possible ij values}).\\ \text{ Similarly, in case of subtraction, corresponding}\\ \text{elements are subtracted.}
